answers.answer: Hi there. The various side effects and overdose effects of vasopressin are slow or uneven heart rate, gasping or troubled breathing, chest pain, tingling or loss of sensation in hands or feet, swelling or rapid weight gain, fainting etc. you need to consult your medical cover or insurance regarding the empanelled hospitals and seek medical care at one of the listed hospitals which has an endocrinologist services for diabetes insipidus. Hope this helps. Take care.

question: I have diabetes insipidus and was overdosed in the hospital with my vasopressin when they put in and removed an experimental gastric pacemaker. I am now having problems walking, speaking, and understanding things. I also dehydrate as my diabetes went misdiagnosed for 30 years. Where do I go for help being on medicaid. I live in Washington State out in the country and traveling to big cities is not an option. There is obviously some kind of damage, and I also was very combative after the surgeries and still have trouble with controling emotions. Is there help for me out there?
title: OVERDOES OF VASOPRESSIN
